intro: Pristimera apiculata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock heath, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related plants. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of bell-shaped, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
